item.title: Projects
Teaching
item.description: ESC180 Exam review Jupyter notebook for exam review based on student-requested content. Either download it and run locally, use Google Colab, or this Binder link. For all else (currently WIP), see: github.com/ihasdapie/teaching/

item.title: Engsci Y2S1 Exam Review
item.description: Exam ‘cheat sheets’ for EngSci 2nd year semester fall semester. These were made as part of my own studying for the exams. As 3/6 of my exams were cancelled due to the omicron covid variant, AER210, MAT292, and PHY293 are missing. I do not guarantee content correctness – but if you find a mistake, please let me know! Table of Contents CHE260 Variables Heat Transfer Mechanisms Steady Heat Transfer Fins Transient Heat Transfer Semi-Infinite Solids Forced Convection Heat Transfer Other: Radiation Heat Transfer Other ECE253: Digital and Computer Systems Logic and Circuits Karnaugh Maps Other: Circuits to know Verilog ARM Assembly Instructions Using PC, LR Subroutines Stacks Recursion Interrupts IO MAT292 AER210 PHY293 ESC203 CHE260 Note: the following only contains materials for the final exam, so it will only cover the heat-transfer portion of CHE260.

item.title: Advent of Code 2021
item.description: Table of Contents Day 6 Day 7 Day 8 Day 9 Day 10 Day 12 Day 13 Day 14 Day 15 Day 16 Day 17 Day 18 Day 19 Day 20 Day 21 Day 22 Day 23 Day 24 Day 25 This page will track some notes and TILs for AoC2021, which I will be completing in rust – a language I am still learning.

item.title: (g)o (w)eb (s)erver
item.description: Deploying your personal website onto github pages is so 2013. Why avoid the hassle of self-hosting with a static site generator and server? Why not just use something tried and tested by the community? It’s just not as fun … and I didn’t feel like studying for a final one afternoon. So here’s a simple 111-line golang webserver that you can use to deploy your personal website. There’s also some cute figlet art
